abstract: Massive snow storm mostly bypasses New York City but hits New England hard; is one of worst for Boston area, which gets 23 inches of snow; Nantucket loses all power and communication with mainland.
lead_paragraph: High winds and whiteout conditions swept across New England as the storm moved up the East Coast, leaving the island of Nantucket without power.

byline.contributor: Katharine Q. Seelye reported from Boston, and Jess Bidgood from Providence, R.I. Hattie Bernstein contributed reporting from Groton, Mass., and Murray Carpenter from Belfast, Me.
byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JESS BIDGOOD

snippet: High winds and whiteout conditions swept across New England as the storm moved up the East Coast, leaving the island of Nantucket without power.

headline.main: Storm That Glanced at Region Hit Hard in New England
headline.print_headline: Storm That Glanced at Region Hit Hard in New England
